page.title: 03Industry in Johnstone
page.content: {Highcraig Quarry}extracts 300,000 tonnes of Basalt per annum for use in road-making(tar) and in concrete constructions.Most rock goes to tar for roads and the main customer is Strathclyde Regional Council.The 35 man workforce, plus another 25, who work on road services, are assured employment for another 12 years. A long established firm in the area is Smith & McLaurin, who specialise in coating papers for use on many common products including whisky bottle labels, record labels and biscuit covers. The mill is the biggest printing house in Europe, employing 150 workers and exporting to 48 countries. Other employment in the block is provided by several small companies in printing, engineering and chemicals.
